revised_title: Multiple Scattering of 4.5 MeV Electrons: Experimental Investigation and Comparison with Moliere Theory
tldr: This article presents an experimental investigation of the multiple scattering of 4.5 MeV electrons by various foils, such as aluminum, copper, molybdenum, silver, and platinum. The results are compared with the Moliere theory, showing good agreement in the region of plural scattering. The study provides insights into the angular distribution of scattered electrons and helps improve our understanding of particle interactions.
